[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2331053][img]https://www.hackforums.news/assets/v4/notablethreads-mix.png[/img][/url][/align]

[color=#FFFFFF][b]Informational Threads[/b][/color]
[list]
[*][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6080644][color=#FFFFFF]Nursing Home Abuser[/color][/url] - [mention=3104967]
Recently in the news a man who works in a nursing home has been highlighted all over the news, sadly its not for a good thing. The man has been abusing the elderly members by beating them. The man thought it was a good idea to record himself doing this and post it online for some silly reason. He is also heard being racist towards some of them too.

[*][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6078301][color=#FFFFFF]Ransomware hackers target Donald Trump[/color][/url] - [mention=3569962]
Last week we mentioned that there was a group of hackers targeting famous people and that their next target was Donald Trump. Well, these hackers are back in this week's edition because they have started to try and hack Mr. Trump, showing they mean what they have said. They have found a lot of data about future plans and are asking for a massive ransom for the data not to be leaked.
[/list]

[color=#FFFFFF][b]Entertaining Threads[/b][/color]
[list]
[*][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6080938][color=#FFFFFF]What's the most high risk, low reward thing you've ever done?[/color][/url] - [mention=3459543]
flavoral has asked a unique question to everyone here at Hack Forums. What is the most high-risk thing you have ever done but then later found it has had a really bad reward at the end? We all have risked a lot of things for a really bad reward but sometimes it's just the thrill of risking something, not just the reward.

[*][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6081000][color=#FFFFFF]Whats the most controversial thing you believe in?[/color][/url] - [mention=183072]
We all believe some really silly things, but sometimes we can believe in some really silly things like the Coronavirus isn't real or it's caused by 5G. Mr Kewl has asked everyone what they believe in but it is really silly. Many members have posted some odd things, but we really wanted to spread the word because some of them are just too funny.

[*][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6080765][color=#FFFFFF]What's one of the smartest things you've ever spent money on?[/color][/url] - [mention=4713562]
We all spend our money on a lot of things but sometimes we buy things that we don't see going far but the next time you check what you have bought you have found that the thing is making you a fortune or has just maybe even saved your life. Make sure you share it on dumbledore thread since it just adds to the good read.
[/list]

[color=#FFFFFF][b]Contests & Giveaways[/b][/color]
[list]
[*][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6081093][color=#FFFFFF][OP8] 2x Free Windows VPS Giveaway || 5x Free Web Hosting || 2x Linux VPS[/color][/url] - [mention=3030547]
The group OP8 is giving away some very nice things this week with four VPS's up for grabs and even some free web hosting services. These services will be shared out between nine lucky winners so if you are looking to try something new and are in need of a VPS and don't want to spend anything, go ahead and get yourself posting in this giveaway thread.

[*][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=6079538][color=#FFFFFF]$50 BTC Giveaway [Upgraded Users][/color][/url] - [mention=11357]
Are you an upgraded member looking to make some easy bitcoin? Well, look no more because Rally the Bulls is giving away $50 bitcoin to one very lucky winner. The giveaway will be ending on the 29th of May so make sure you get your entry before its too late.
[/list]

[align=center][img]https://www.hackforums.news/assets/v4/technews-invisible.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]World Record Internet Speeds[/color][/b]
Everyone is always trying to get the fastest internet speeds with the lowest price going back and forth with ISP's. Fiber is the fastest speed you can get if you live in an environment that supports it, or if an ISP is willing to lay a fiber cable for it. Research at Monash University in Australia and RMIT universities has reached a new level of speed, 44.2 Tbps (TeraBits per second). “That’s theoretically enough speed to download the contents of more than 50 100GB Ultra HD Blu-ray discs in a single second.” This connection was a test run between the two universities by an integrated chip embedded in the cables that could be used in the current existing fiber infrastructure in the future. Researchers are currently trying to figure out how to bring this modern technology to the public and then have an initial release. These kinds of internet speeds are far from being inexpensive, for now we're going to stick to the standard fiber optic.[i][size=x-small][url=https://www.theverge.com/2020/5/22/21267321/broadband-internet-speed-record-australia-researchers-micro-comb-fiber] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Big Update for Windows Search Function[/color][/b]
Apple's Spotlight search function has always been a fantastic feature on Macs that Windows does not currently offer. Well, that's changing as Windows Search gets an update from a tool named PowerToys Run, which removes the Windows key-R shortcut. The tool is currently on [url=https://github.com/microsoft/PowerToys/releases]GitHub[/url] and is in its very early stages. The new search function can be started with the Alt-space shortcut and will pop up in the middle of your screen with a query box just like the Spotlight search on Mac.[i][size=x-small][url=https://www.cnn.com/2020/05/20/tech/microsoft-windows-search/index.html] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Another Legal Battle for Facebook[/color][/b]
An Israeli security firm has recently come under fire to impersonate Facebook as a tactic to get users to install "phone hacking apps," according to a study released recently. The NSO refuted these claims when Motherboard, a news site, made those accusations against them. They also claim that evidence of the spread of their tool was also found on US servers, but the NSO called this "recycled conjecture." When this spyware is enabled, you'll be able to read text messages, monitor the GPS location, and everything else on your mobile phone. Facebook is currently in a legal battle with NSO, claiming that WhatsApp has infected hundreds of users.[i][size=x-small][url=https://www.bbc.com/news/technology-52758784] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]   [/color]

[align=center][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=4570721][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v4/animenews-megane.png[/img][/url][/align]

[b][color=white]Phantasy Star Online 2 Game Launches on PC in N. America on May 27[/color][/b]
Good news for those who want to play the popular Japanese MMORPG, Phantasy Star Online 2. Originally, the game was only available in Japan. To access it, in countries outside of Japan you needed to download a specific version of the game which allowed you to use a patch that would change the in-game text into whatever language you desired. Sega announced that the game was coming to North America this past year, however, during this announcement it was only for the Xbox One. The game was released in April and, of course, those without an Xbox One had no chance of playing the game. Recently, Sega Tweeted out an announcement stating that the game will be coming to PC in North America on May 27! [i][size=x-small][url=website]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]McDonald's Ramune McShake Gets Animated Ad[/color][/b]
It's not the first time McDonald's Japan uses animated commercial shorts to advertise their products. In their latest commercial, they advertised their newest drink perfect for the summer weather. Considering that Japan gets extremely hot during spring and summer, why not go down to McDonald's to enjoy a nice, cold ramune shake. Well, what exactly is ramune? Ramune is a Japanese carbonated soft drink. It was introduced to the Japanese by an Englishmen, Alexander Cameron Sim. The name derives from the old Japanese word of saying "lemonade". The original flavor is considered to have a lemon-lime taste. In modern times, there are various ones you can choose from, but it looks like McDonald's will only carry their take on the original flavor. You can take a look at the animated short [url=https://youtu.be/35nSBB0sdkQ]here[/url]. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/interest/2020-05-22/mcdonald-ramune-mcshake-gets-animated-ad/.159811]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Japan Considers Lifting State of Emergency in Tokyo and Osaka[/color][/b]
Activities, stores, and the likes may re-open soon in the Tokyo and Osaka region very soon. Starting with Tokyo first, the Tokyo Governor, Yuriko Koike, states that Tokyo meets the requirements for lifting the state of emergency. Starting from April 7 until May 6, the Japanese prime minister, Shinzo Abe, declared Tokyo, Kanagawa Saitama, Chiba, Osaka, Hyogo, and Fukuoka to the state of emergency. Additionally, Kyoto was shortly added to that list only three days after the declaration on April 7.

Fast-forwarding to now, Tokyo has reported that only three new coronavirus cases have been reported in the past two months. In Tokyo now, there are a reported 5,136 cases of positive tested people who have the virus. Tokyo's government has created a three-phase map which they believe will be best for everyone's safety.

The first phase places such as museums, sports facilities, schools, and things of the like shall re-open. However, places like movie theatres, sporting events (watching people play professional sports, etc) will be disallowed in this phase. Bars and restaurants were asked during the state of emergency to close at 8 P.M. but after phase one starts these establishments will be allowed to stay open until 10.

Once the government tests out the first phase and everything goes to plan, phase two will start. In this phase, theatres, tutoring and driving schools, and non-essential goods stores will be allowed to open their doors. Arcades, amusement parks, casinos, cafés, etc will be allowed to open too. Furthermore, instead of 10 P.M. restaurants and bars will be allowed to close at midnight.

In the last phase, venues that will hold over 1,000 people will still be asked to remain closed. This means live music events, karaoke facilities, and even fitness gyms where people can still gather around closely and social distancing cannot be performed. There's nothing new that was shared about phase three other than what was mentioned in the previous sentence. However, things should be pretty lax (hopefully) by then to allow almost all businesses and events to resume.

As for Osaka, the government will be monitoring Tokyo first before they decide on Osaka. [i][size=x-small][url=https://www.animenewsnetwork.com/news/2020-05-22/japan-considers-lifting-state-of-emergency-in-tokyo-early-next-week/.159822]>>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]   [/color][/size][/font]
